text: This place is good and dirty. I liked it from hello. Under the train tracks by Wrigley. I knew it would be good because there was a K9 cop eating in the joint. This is a joint if ever there was. You can dress me up but.... The hot sauces were spicy, the game was on, the diners were representing. The chips weren't my favorite, perhaps they were stale?

This is probably the worst "Mexican" food I have ever had. I ordered a chicken burrito and the chicken tasted as if it had been sitting in a bucket of old mop water! If you want great tacos try pacos tacos, not this overpriced tasteless garbage

Such a great authentic Mexican taco joint, it's located directly underneath the Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) Red Line. We stumbled upon this place while we were walking out of the Cubs vs. Yankees game Sunday evening.  It was such a great choice to come in since the tacos reminded me of the Forest Hills Taco Truck. You can add additional items to your liking; the pricing was the usual for authentic tacos. We forgot to take pictures because we were really hungry but believe us this is the best taco in town.

Came here about 2am on a Saturday and the line was out the door. Ordered the pork and steak taco meal which was decent for an open-late Mexican joint. Portion size was also good. I didn't care for the salsa, the flavor was there but not in a good way, and the customer service was rather poor. When I asked for a cup of water, a worker said, "I'm too busy." Wow.  Lastly, the prices are a bit outrageous for a place that puts out mediocre food and mainly serves a drunken crowd. If you're craving Mexican and want to save some money, head down the street to Taco Bell.

I order a Steak Burrito with everything on it, I got my order a steak burrito with lettuce and tomatoes. Burrito mostly full with lettuce with very little meat. I went back to the cashier with my plate and asked him, where's my everything on it that I asked for, he said I had to be specific. Worst place ever, never again!
Honestly, this was the worst burrito I've ever had. I am currently going to Taco Bell to supplement my pallet. The price is fine but the food is terribly bland

Extremely disappointed with my visit. Now, I'm not from this area so I took a risk trying something new. I ordered a torta de asada, which I'm very familiar with. Keep in mind, my order was only $9 and some change which is fairly reasonable BUT, they do not take card, which was a major downside. The food wasn't that good and considering the location (literally right next to the train) it was a bummer I hadn't eaten all day and was looking for something tasteful/memorable and I got the complete opposite. On the plus side, they have pretty good salsa, though the chips seemed a bit greasy. There was an off taste to their salsa verde and you know the rest... I won't be coming back here. 1/4 of my friends enjoyed the food and on top of all negative, my friend did not enjoy her food and when she asked if she could order something else, they said she would have to pay for a whole separate order. Now, being from my town, if a place screws up they give you another meal, free of charge. Now, if she were to have paid for a new order and didn't like that one, they obviously would've had no sympathy. Huge thumbs down to burrito mexicano
Very small place.  I don't expect too much from this place.  But their food are always good , well cooked.
Excellent. Authentic. Great little hole in the wall. I highly recommend a chorizo breakfast burrito or the chili relleno.

Still the greatest!  Been going here for 15 years now and haven't found a better chorizo taco in the world...yes, in the world.  Don't forget it's cash only.  Stay and get the chips and salsa, the pico de gallo is excellent too.
Good burritos, but overcharged my card. Never visiting this place again. That dollar and fourteen cents probably wasnt worth losing my business.

Is there a lower rating than 1 star?  Went here for some late night eats with a friend.  At best, this was a learning experience as I now know to trust my senses before trusting where to eat.  Before I ordered, I looked at the grill and the meat on it didn't look right.  Hate to say it but it was 'greyish' in color.  I ordered anyways and as soon as I ate and left, I was throwing up violently in the alley.  I had not been drinking this evening or anything so it was the food.  I talked to my friend the next day and he had spent the end of his evening throwing up as well.  DO NOT GO HERE!!

Simply average. A wee bit pricey, but I think it's because they're within a stone's throw of Wrigley field and around the corner from the redline. Nothing special. Somewhat flavorful although I'd never go back. The place is a little dirty too and quite dated.
Great burritos close to wrigley. Seating can be a challenge, but otherwise no complaints. You get what you pay for here - hot, delicious, authentic Chicago-style Mexican food.

Man been coming here since a shorty, love this place. It's open late hours so really great for after hours clubbing, bar hoping etc. vegetarian options as well which I love. We went after the deciding factor for Cubs vs dodgers game, it was so packed line around corner and still got our food in an appropriate timing, definitely would recommend!

I had the picadillo burrito which has ground beef.  It was good with the sour cream added.  I don't care for rice inside a burrito so it was nice it doesn't have that. Salsa was good but on the hot side. Some pork green chili wold be a great addition. Very nice staff and service.

Little hole in the wall place located near Wrigley and the red line.  Stopped in here after the game, and it wasn't too busy as everyone was busy trying to get on the red line. We grabbed three tacos to share and a water to share as a nice little snack before we started walking home.  Two chicken and a beef to share.  The chicken reminded me of the chicken inside of a chicken enchilada, it was very good.  The beef too!  Tacos were a little bigger than we had expected, which was a nice plus! Definitely a good stop if you don't want to wait in the line for the metro after a game.
The only place I've ever been to where a quesadilla = a small corn shell taco + cheese. Wouldn't recommend.

This place is perfect once you're done watching a ball game. You know good food when you're drunk, well this is good food when you sober too! It's a tiny joint, cash only, but they're service is quick enough for you to order and by the time you have your tacos or steak torta, someone else is done, you can quickly sit down and be done for the next guy to take your place. Quite efficient if you ask me and the food is very good. The horchata is real good too, perfect blend of sugar and spice. Yum.

enchiladas were so good! we got red and green ones, with chicken. didn't have enough hot sauce in the takeout order--the red sauce was especially good, had a nice kick to it. delicious, nice big portions.

Perfect place to go to for late night munchies and consistently has good food. Cash only. I like the quesadillas, tamales and the guacamole.  I was once feeling very hungover when I came here and the nice cook man behind the counter gave me some sprite, salt, and lime mixed together which really helped. Apparently it works even better with some tequila added to the mix! The workers are usually pretty funny to talk to. Solid Mexican. Don't forget the horchata!

Stopped in after a concert, although it was late it was packed.  A local told us some good things so we ordered the chicken burrito with extra beans, avocado and sour cream...have to say it was AWESOME!  Maybe the best one I ever had not because it was in anyway fancy but it was fresh, well seasoned and the chicken wasn't dry.  Can't wait to go back tonight!

Small, fast, inexpensive (for the area), and okay portion sizes. There are tons of great Mexican restaurants around the city and this one did not disappoint but it also did not stand out in any way either. The salsas were good but the meat in different items I tried (burrito suizo and torta) could've been more tender and marinated with more flavor.

Thursday morning would've been dire (underline/bold) had our Uber in Shining Chevy Armor not wheeled us to El Burrito en route back to our hotel.  After striking out by a few minutes up near Irving Park (it was a Wednesday night, I'm sure these folks thought -- who is OUT right now!?), I resigned myself that no burritos were going to be in our future. Luckily, our Uber driver rolled in a mini-van and had some serious chops for late night eats on the Northside. He zipped us over to the Addison el stop pronto and 10 minutes and $55 later I had a bag o' burritos weighing in at around 10lbs. We delayed instant gratification in respect for our revered tour guide -- no burritos open in an Uber or Taxi, that's just not cool, particularly if you are lacking coordination. They are messy to eat if sober, disastrous while potentially slightly 17 sheets to the wind.  Suffice it to say -- these burritos were wolfed down unceremoniously in the lobby of our hotel, and everyone in the crew thanked the burrito gods the next morning (and right then, too -- really).  Most all of us had the carne asada -- a solid choice. These burritos aren't haute cuisine but after you've made some poor decisions it'll seem like the best thing that's every crossed your lips. The guys at the shop were nice (but I'm sure thankful we were not eating in as they'd already stacked the chairs up). I wouldn't make a habit of using the bathroom but it would do in an real emergency.  Cash only.  Carne Asada.  Salvation.  I also laughed when my Spanish colleague said -- "we are going to a place called the Mexican Burrito? It's very straightforward in its name." Hahahhaah, indeed!

Best burrito in the City of Chicago and it's not even close. Whether you're on a date or looking for a late night bite, this place works. Always playing a live soccer game on the TV and serving up fresh burritos.

Came here twice last week. AMAZING.  I live in Los Angeles and even tho we have great Mexican food everywhere, I'd be as bold to say as I haven't come across anything this great in LA.  Period.  I kinda wanna book a flight back to the chi just for another burrito.

Since I moved to the north side, I've been having trouble finding a good Mexican food place. But I finally found it! I love this place, the food and the service are outstanding. Most important, the food actually tasted like Mexican food.
Good burrito, seasoned chicken, not a lot of other ingredients inside, but filling and tasty, reasonably priced.  Friendly, fast service too.  Highly recommended!

My go-to Mexican place in Chicago, will truly be missed now when I've moved out. Those Al Pastor tacos are excellent and the Horchata is amazing. Guacamole and the chips are great, burrito mexican style and a bunch of other burritos are great too. Hot sauce is on point. Not everything is perfect though, the chicken is kinda meh and the Chorizo seemed to have been laying around for a while considering how my tummy felt after trying it. The beef quesadilla is okay but nothing more. Also with the tacos al pastor you will get some pretty dry lime slices about half the times. Since they increased their prices a couple of months I stopped going a lot less frequently than I used to do. Only cash is pretty annoying as well. All-in-all a great Mexican place with great opening hours but needs to improve some things to be a 5-star.

Authentic Mexican food and open really late at night. It's in a great spot as it's a block away from Wrigley Field and right underneath the Red Line.  Unfortunately they only accept cash, but they do have an ATM inside.
First time here and I was so impressed with the food. It's a diamond in the rough type of place. I had a chorizo, chicken and beef tongue taco. They were all delicious!! Will definitely be back!!

So i ordered "Steak burrito with rice and beans on the side" (verbatim)  and the cash register lady said "rice and beans?" and I said yes. So apparently that means that I only wanted a $9 burrito with ONLY steak, rice, and beans ....Went back to change my order to explain and they said I had to pay an additional $8...mind you the "meal" is $8 something... VERY RUDE.  So i was stuck with a burrito with only rice, beans and rice.....REALLY???

Great simple and big burritos, super quick service, and they're not even crowded after Cubs games, probably because it's cash only and a bit of a hole in the wall. They'll give you chips and salsa if you eat in. It's not terribly expensive either.

This place is just insanely great late night Mexican fare with loads of fresh ingredients in a super convenient location right at the Addison L-Stop.  I would highly recommend a burrito when you stop by and you'll be happy you did.

I had never been to Chicago before this past weekend (besides a flight transfer) and having a very small amount of "good mexican" to my native Southern Californian palette, I was definitely searching for a good mexican place to satiate my enormous burrito appetite. See, the problem with most mexican food in the midwest is that while it may be good in it's own fashion, it does not replicate the mexican food I grew up with in San Diego. So after much research looking over the city of Chicago for a good place, I decided to try this place since it is right off the red line. And by right off the red line, I mean literally right off the line: you get off at Wrigley and turn to the opposite side and it's there. It was wonderful. The menu is written in both English and Spanish and the chefs are unequivocally of mexican descent. These things I thought were typical of all mexican food taco shops but I'm finding out here in the Midwest it is not the norm. Finding this to be true was a great start. I ordered a carne asada burrito without beans, a carne asada taco, and an al pastor taco. My wife ordered a bean and cheese burrito with sour cream. I was hungry and excited, ok?? It was pretty hot in the taco shop so the wife and I walked down Addison to the lake for some relief. Great spot if you are thinking about it, just 12 minutes or so to walk there. The carne asada was cooked perfectly and the seasoning on it was delicious. The red salsa is also the perfect amount of kick to it for me as well. I couldn't get over the fact that I was eating the best food I had since moving out to the Midwest (Cleveland) in over a year. It was incredible. The Al Pastor taco was even better than the burrito. Literally no complaints about the Al Pastor. If I had one suggestion about the burrito it was that there wasn't enough cheese (I like cheese) and the tortilla was more on the uncooked texture (still cooked but had that more uncooked flour taste to it). My wife loved the tortilla as a side note. If I ever end up in Chicago again, I will absolutely go back to El Burrito Mexicana without question. Not just great Chicago mexican food but great mexican food in general.

My son left his Jorge Soler Cubs bobble head at the table after dinner, no one else left the restaurant and I went back in to get it. Sure enough it was gone and "no one had seen it." The food was fine, but don't leave your belongings behind if you don't want them snaked. Stay classy El Burrito.
Cheap with huge portions. Comes with chips and selection of 3 salsas. Cash only, but has an atm and is worth the minor inconvenience. Chorizo is nicely spiced and tacos are well dressed.

Get the chicken quesadillas. It comes in three little taco shaped quesadillas. They rock. The sign says 'best burrito', but I would pass on those in a second for the cheesy deliciousness of the quesadillas.

Great spot if you love Mexican food.  i have ventured here many late nights and occasional afternoons. Overall a good spot is you really want authentic flavors.  I love that their taco options are more than the usual corner spots.  if you are a true foodie, then try their beef tongue tacos with cilantro, onion, a hint of salt and lime juice...so freakin delicious!!!  Also a good spot for a grab n go.  I have frequented this spot after work many a time for a few tacos, chips and guac and their Horchata.   Love that this place is cheap so it will not break the bank at ALL and open late on the weekends.  They do have a breakfast menu too if that is your thing. What else can I say?  Great food, great prices, great spot = great deal!

The food is great. I had a pork taco dinner and my wife had a chicken burrito dinner.  The flavors were great and the pico that came with chips was great.  Not a fancy place, order at the counter and they bring it to you.  The only negative was that we were there after a Cubs game and there was an unruly drunk at the next table.  Better to avoid Wrigleyville on game days.

Bottom of the barrel tacos al pastor. Just because I've been drinking doesn't mean I'm stupid. Honestly not good, unauthentic. However, great for drunk folks who would rather go here than Taco Bell. Only redeeming factor. Try again guys
This is the spot to go for a late night snack or on your way home from a Cubs game. I Remember to bring cash.  My favorite is the chicken burrito with chips and the green salsa.

Stopped here for a late night snack after a night out with friends. This place is nothing amazing. If you are looking for good Mexican food, don't come here. Is a really small place. My burrito was just ok. But not many places are open late, so if you need a late night snack give it a try. And after a night out, it maybe the best Mexican food you ever had.

Great place to pick late night tacos. I especially recommend the pastor and the lengua. Nothing fancy here but that is not what you are looking for in a late night taqueria. If you eat in they provide chips and salsa. All in all a good late night option.

I    ısppoıňţıň ×pıňċ ţ  ňıţ ouţ ıň ıı.  I ordered a chicken quesadilla and what I got looked like a smooshed chicken taco. It had a lot of unflavorful meat with a glob of cheese in the middle. It was cheap and it should in their food. I do not recommend.

I just moved in across the street and stumbled upon it after a night out. I went back the next day because the tacos were that good!! Authentic and delicious. The pork tacos are my favorite!  It's open late. Also it's cash only, but there is an ATM there.

This place is amazing!!!! The chicken tacos are my favorite. The best chicken tacos I've had in a very long time, they are huge, juicy and full of flavor.  I am currently addicted! Also the guys are always so friendly. For some good tacos I definitely recommend this place. So happy I found it!

I come here every once in a while when I'm in the mood for a good burrito, I came here today and was severely disappointed to the quality of meat that was in the burrito and the lettuce was very dry and tasted very old.

I'm a very hardcore critic when it comes to Mexican food, especially because I don't eat meat the flavor has GOT to be in the beans and salsa.  Here, well it's not the best I've ever had and not the worst.  I got a bean tostada and a veggie burrito sin rice.  The salsa's are good. The food is okay, not the best.  One guy working here is super nice.  Probably  a great spot after a night of drinking and getting on or off the Addison Red El stop.

So the food is really good. I get the guacamole pretty much once a week and it's always delicious - huge portion and made to order. The downside is the place is kinda gross. The guy making the food doesn't wear gloves, and I've seen him wipe his nose in the middle of mashing up my avocado. Probably no different that what goes on in most kitchens, but this is a counter and I can see it and it kind of taints the whole experience. Still, the food is so good I have to keep coming back.
OMG, sooooooooooo good! I LOVE this place. The food is awesome :))

This is one of my favorite late night spots for tacos. I had never before realized that tacos could taste so good until a friend recommended this and they were so delicious they knocked my socks off. My favorite is the al pastor, and with them being so cheap, I can get several at a time.
My burrito was good, not great. It came out quickly and was piping hot. The chips and salsa were satisfactory nothing impressive

Went here before a game at Wrigley Field.  This was easily the worst Mexican food me and my friend had ever eaten.  We threw half of it away because it was so bad.  Even the chips were vile.  How do you mess up chips!?!  And the woman taking our orders seemed like she couldn't care less about us.  I guess I'd hate my job too if I had to work at that garbage heap.
I have dreams about this steak burrito. It is the universe. Glorious.

Updating this to five stars. I went back during the daytime and got an assortment of tacos and tostadas and holy WOW, were they all good! I don't even like Al Pastor, usually - but here it's just top notch.

I had dinner plans at another place but those fell through, so my group of 6 stumbled in here. I have passed this place 100s of times but have not had  a chance to try it. I'm sad I've missed out for so long. The girl behind the counter was really nice. The place is clean and has plenty of seating for a larger group. I went for the burrito al pastor. It came out and was the size of my face. The most impressive thing was the amount of meat I got within the burrito, all at the price of $8 plus tax. On top of that, it's BYOB and I good location. I will definitely be back.

For just under $9, you can score one of the best al pastor burritos in the city, a side order of rice and beans that actually does not suck, and space that features enough tables for a small group and it's BYO.  Add in quick service and a friendly person manning the register, and I can see why this place is crowded around game times at Wrigley.  This would be a dangerous spot to live next to, because you will leave stuffed after putting down that massive burrito and a cold beer.  Yessir!

NOW WERE TALKING. This is basically the ONLY good taqueria in the Lincoln Park Area.  100 percent authentic, U got the Mexican personalities, Virgin de Guadalupe, No Credit Cards , cheap, a one person bathroom, And soccer. Every thing that maker a taco Joint The Chicken Tortas r the best in the world. I'm a Mexican i can say that. The tacos are above average and the breakfast is amazing.  This place takes a shit on allendes and taco burrito hell and will make u question why this place is in lakeview and not in heaven serving pancho villa .

I'm a little biased, writing this review. I live down the street and it's within walking distance. So when I get a quick burrito craving, this is the go-to place. Plus it's below the red line, so I can always grab something on the way home if I'm in the mood.  The food is cooked to order, so there's always a bit of a wait when ordering pick up, bit again, we should all be used to that. Service is fast efficient and friendly. Prices are very reasonable and the food, while not extraordinary, always fits the bill and satisfies.

I live in wrigleyville and this place is good.  Both drunk and sober. I get the el pastor burrito and my roommate gets hard shell taco's the only down fall is that on weekends the place is packed late night.

If you don't feel like waiting for 45 minutes at Taco Bell in the post-bar drunk food rush, try El Burrito Mexicano.  It looks pretty sketchy on both the outside (and the inside too, let's be honest), but the food is quality and they make it right in front of you!   My favorite is the al pastor tacos-- the burritos and nachos use a bit too much sour cream for my liking but anything you try uses real ingredients, meaning fresh avocados and real melted cheese instead of that gross queso sauce that so many restaurants use. It's right by the Addison train tracks, so uber convenient, and it's cash only too.

I lived near Wrigley for the past 3 years and El Burrito was my go-to place.  I went there almost every week because the food is soooo good.  It's a classic hole-in-the-wall place that doesn't look like much on the outside, but serves amazing food (at a great price!) on the inside.  Far better than a fancier sit-down Mexican restaurant.  The burrito suizo was always my favorite, but all of their food is good.

French Fries and tacos.....  Can't beat it.  Great late night joint for  some good mexican food.  I actually have been here sober also and the food is great. It is cash only so make sure you don't show expecting to pay with credit.  I usually get el pastor taco, chicken taco and some papas fritas.  Not sure how Taco Bell is in business down the street.
A great place to attend before going to the ballgame. The good taste very well and reasonable food portions for the value for the amount given.

Although it looks like pretty sketchy restaurant with questionable food from the outside, it's anything but. Located right under the Addison Red Line tracks is this gem of a restaurant. I had heard rave reviews from a baseball fanatic friend and I decided I needed to try it next time I was in Wrigleyville. It's a cash only restaurant with a typical Mexican-style menu. I had a delicious Carne Asada burrito and it was made in less than 5 minutes. Wonderful meat to cheese to lettuce ratio with just enough tortilla to keep it all wrapped up. The meat was seasoned perfectly and I found it difficult to stop eating that delicious burrito.  I also ordered a small horchata. For a whole-in-the-wall restaurant, it was pretty good. It wasn't the best horchata, but it was far from the worst I've ever had. The consistency was perfect (not thick at all) but I think it could've used a bit more cinnamon. Nevertheless, it was the perfect beverage for my meal and I will definitely buy the horchata again.

You may look at the location (right under L tracks) and the name (like there are other countries famous for burritos?) but the food is great.  Cash only, limited seating, but open late and always good.  Further, the television is usually on Univision, so if you go there during the day, you can probably catch up on your Telenovelas.   One thing - on a late night when the bars close, especially on the weekend, you may run into people trying to eat away all the whiskey shots they just poured into their eyes.  So, be aware of that.

My Clark Kent used to live around the corner from this place and for the longest time, I refused to ever try it. I one time ordered a burrito late-night, but ended up giving it to a friend instead. Tryin' to watch my figure, ya know? Finally tried my own burrito the week CK was moving out. I was over to help pack up and we decided on a quick and nearby dinner. First reaction: WHY HADN'T I TRIED THIS BEFORE?!? It's unreal. Fresh, creamy, delicious, not as intimidating as Chipotle. It is seriously authentic and delicious. The workers seem a little like grumpy goats all the time, but I assume it's because they generally see a lot of drunk, rude, stupid people because of their location (right next to the Addison Red Line stop). Cash only too, so I can't imagine that someone with a few drinks in them that didn't notice the sign at first would be very happy about that.  At any rate, worth the grumpy workers and cash only. It's awesome and I will totally be back here often this summer.

Solid 3.5 stars for their breakfast burrito.  The other night I was reading reviews about breakfast burritos in Cali because I missed them and they're hard to find in Chicago.  It's so simple to make and yet they are so very different.  Problem is, in Chicago they put rice and beans in every friggin' burrito, so they do the same with a breakfast burrito.  Price is another factor.  In California they are cheaper(no rice & beans), here because they have already factored rice and beans into the cost you may pay about $5 dollars plus up to $7 dollars.  Which is about the cost of a breakfast burrito meal at El Burrito.   Long story short.. which is so fucking cliche and I can't help but make it long.  I stopped by late night and ordered one minus the rice, beans and guac and added cheese and chorizo.  Also got a lengua and chicken taco as well.  Also requested for hot shit, sauce or jalapenos to be added to my burrito.  I like that they mixed the egg in with chorizo, cheese and jalapenos so it was all formed together like.  They offered red salsa (on the side) which is supposed to be spicy, (to me) mildly spicy.  I wish they offered the thick kind of spicy salsa verde which is made with tomatillos, avocado and some chilies.  This sauce is prevalent in California.  Any who.. the burrito was pretty good and it was as big as their dinner burrito.  Kudos on the proper wrapping.  I tend not to appreciate these dive Mexican joints in Chicago but per reviews every once in awhile you can find somewhere decent.  I've just had very bad luck with taquerias in the past.

I ate there sober tonight and the food was boring and bland; salt barely helped the steak burrito.  The friend I went with used both salsa and was still bored with the flavor. Taco Burrito Palace on Halsted is WAY better.

*Attention Californians* Yes, this place will make you some decent Carne Asada Fries. You just have to tell them exactly how you like it by pretty much compiling the list of what goes in it.  Personally, I ask for fries, cheese, guac, sour cream, carne asada, and pico de gallo (on the side because they like to put a lot and it gets too soggy). My only issue with the carne asada fries is that the french fries that they use are the thick cut kind that are very potato-y and my preference is thin fries. But oh well, it's good enough to temporarily satisfy my cravings.  And I give them extra credit for dealing with the Wrigleyville drunks for this long.

Definitely by far my favorite authentic Mexican restaurant in Chicago. Authentic refried beans, awesome nachos layered with monterey jack cheese, avacado, and lots of other good stuff. They have these awesome big burritos that are the size of Chipotle burritos, but actually taste like authentic Mexican food. Pretty much everything I've ever had there has been good. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because they don't have queso blanco (white cheese dip), but I don't think any of the Mexican restaurants in Chicago have queso blanco.
Best Mexi in Chicago.. Awesome tacos..
3 AM? Blackout drunk? Chorizo and Egg Burrito? ahhhhh.... the perfect combination for my ride home on the redline. This place is awesome.

This place and the workers are so cute!  It's a cute little Mexican joint.  Is that reason enough to like it?  Weeeeellll.... I ordered beef tacos.  Little did I know that they included carrots in their beef mixture because it didn't say that on the menu board.  I hate cooked carrots!  Also, I asked the guy for nacho cheese in a cup for dipping.  He rang it up, no questions asked.  When I got home and opened the cup, I saw it was a cup full of shredded chihuahua cheese!  I cannot dip in that!  I was whining to my Mexican friend about the experience and he told me 1) some joints include carrots in their beef mixure and 2) I got shredded cheese because the real Mexican places don't use pre-melted cheese or cheese sauce.   So, maybe the minor two flaws I found are due to my ignorance.  Beyond that, I do like the place.  I will try it again, but ask about the specifics on my next order.

One of the best Mexican food places in Wrigleyville! The guys who work there are the best as well. I love getting the steak burrito with extra meat. They really hook you up on the amount of food that they put in the burritos. Its pretty inexpensive and always open late on the weekends, which is great for a late night burrito after the bars. They also give you free chips and salsa when you dine inside the place. Overall it's a great Mexican place to eat.
I love their Crispy carne Asada Tacos! Free chips and salsa when you dine in.  The crew are very  nice, cash only.

I like how close to this is my place, but other than that it isn't mind blowing Mexican. It seems authentic enough. And when you order it is pretty fast. I usually always get the chicken burrito meal, which includes rice and beans. The protion is plenty and I always feel full, but I feel like the flavor lacks just a little something. I can't stand cash only places. I've only just recently moved to Chicago so I haven't had the chance to get a bank around here so ATM fees kill me. Let's all grow up a little and get with the plastic. Either way, NO CASH.

These guys are so good at their jobs.  They deal with drunk a-holes all day and all night and still keep their cool!!  They are always so nice.  The food is DELICIOUS, and I've been to Mexico City so I can attest that it is quite awesome at El Burrito Mexicano.  I like the nachos con pollo myself, although nothing says drunk at 3am quite like a big fatty burrito.  Wish they had delivery!!

I love this place!  After a late night of drinking this is where it's at.  Service is quick and friendly.  Burritos are authentic and stuffed full of goodness.  Just make sure you bring cash as they don't accept credit cards.

I love this place! The food is as good as it gets for fast Mexican food in Chicago. The staff is very friendly, even knows my order from the get go! I love beef tacos, my wife just loves the chicken nachos.  I give this place the nick name tacos under the train due to the proximity to Addison Red Line.  What are you waiting for? Stop in, they are open 10 AM to 4 AM on the weekends.

Conveniently located right off the Addison, red line (seriously, right off) El Burrito Mexicano will get more stars from me the day I eat here sober. All in all the food here gets the job done.  Try to time it to avoid the wall hugging drunks, and sidestep the sometimes agitated state of the young guys trying to learn how to hold both food and alcohol down and it'll be okay.
Best burrito I have ever eaten in Chicago! I love that it's open late and it's a great place to hit before going home after a night out. Delicious. Cheap. Great location. Can't be beat.

Very good asada, fresh and flavorful. A nice end to the day after a Cubs game before hitting the red line. Pico de gallo is very good, and the salsa verde stacks up to some of the better taquerias. Not a very clean place though, mostly due to the tons of drunk 20 somethings inside.  UPDATE: I got tacos the first time (see above). This time I went with a burrito. Honest to God, one of the best Mission-style's I've had in Chicago. I can't wait to go back. I'm upping my score from a 3 to a 4.
I have only been there after a long night in Wrigleyville. It is the ultimate late night food off of the addison stop. Burritos and tacos are all good. Cash only though.

Best burritos in Chicago.  We call it El Mex.  I eat them when I'm sober and I eat them when I'm drunk.  Super location.  I've never had a bad experience at this location or the one in Lisle.  It's the food I miss the most since moving away from Chicago.

I've eaten here a bunch and love it.  Just moved nearby so even better.  Honestly I've only ordered the steak burrito and it's fantastic.  Late night or not, I'll venture over here for a burrito anytime.  The staff is very nice and orders come quick.  I like that they serve free chips and salsa at the tables if you dine in.

I'm going to look past the fact that the cast of Arachnophobia seemed to be having a reunion on the ceiling...I was freaking on the inside as I waited for my order, but it's ok..  I played it safe with El Burrito because I'd never been here before. Ordered two ground beef tacos on my way home. They were okay. The flavor didn't make me want to breakdance around my kitchen, but it wasn't bland. Reasonable price, prompt service, and most importantly, I was not sick the next day. For that, El Burrito and I are on good terms.

Definitely one of my late-night hungry go-tos.  It's a burrito.  It's a delicious burrito.  It is not healthy.  It's not good for you.  It's delicious.  Also, the horchata is fabulous, and while you wouldn't think a mexican joint would have good cheese fries, they are an after midnight must with the salsa verde.   More than that, the staff is wonderful.  Last night some guy was bothering me, and the guy at the counter kicked him out and then walked me around the corner to make sure I'd be safe when I left, stopping drunken Wrigleyville in their Mexican craving tracks.  That's five star service.

I went here last night after a long night out at Rebel and Red Ivy. I was overwhelmed by the menu and had no idea what to order so I just told them to make me something good. The cashier suggested the burrito Mexicano which was really good... but really spicy... and I like spice. It had actual jalapeno in the burrito. I also got it with sour cream and avocado. Other people I was eating with complained that the food was a bit dry... so I would suggest splurging the extra 60 cents for the sour cream.

My burrito was ok, not something special, but definitely not bad.  Chicago has awesome mexican food in general-so if this was in my hometown of Boston I'd give it four stars, but it has some really good competition. I will say that everything is made fresh-and maybe I just didn't like what I got (pork), so there is a chance this could be more of a four star establishment if you go with something else.
Went there again when I was drunk...still terrible. Tacos were dry...it was like eating sand.

This is yet another solid burrito place in Chicago. It's hard to differentiate between some of these places, all of which have similar menus and operations, and while Burrito Mexicano isn't doing anything particularly unique or exciting to make them stick out, they produce damn fine food and sell it at reasonable rates. A great place for some grilled Mexican food if you're in the area, for sure.

Get here drunk, go home happy!   Fantastic burritos in my opinion.  My older brother got me into going here a couple of years ago, and have been surprising my drunken out of town visitors with their food ever since.

I live about 7 blocks away, and I absolutely love this place!!! My friend introduced me to El Burrito and it was love at first sight. Not the most glamorous looking place, but you can't judge on appearances, can you? Food is incredible! I got the lengua and chorizo taco, delicious!! And free chips and salsa? Count me in!!!  Great place for Friday and Saturday night, funny to watch all the drunks, lol!

Their burritos can only be described as "chronic".  This place was recommended to me when I moved to Chicago and I always recommend it to others that are looking for a down and dirty Mexican burrito treat. Muy Delicioso!

So I'm riding the bus with a friend of mine, who is also a gluton, so we constantly discuss food options in the area. And when the topic of mexican came up we both agreed that the best burritos we have had on the north side are from the "little dive under the addison stop" He did warn me that, when intoxicated they have tried overcharging him before, but since they've never pulled such a dubious act on me I can't hold it against them. I haven't tried the entire menu so I don't know if they have any other quality items. But I do know the burrito is great

Yo quiero Taco Bell? No, Yo quiero El Burrito!!  Seriously, you will not want late night Taco Bell after you try this place.  Plus, the wonderfulness of El burrito somehow makes drunk people less obnoxious here. It's also a great place to get some Mexican grub during the day because it is much less busy and you usually get your food in about 5 minutes.  Everything I've had to eat here is fantastic, especially for the price.  Yes, it's not gourmet Mexican, but it is fresh, flavorful, and the meat is never over-cooked.  My favorite is the carne asada burrito, but the burrito a la mexican is equally amazing (especially if you like spicy).  The cheese fries are my 2nd favorite.  Cheese fries at a Mexican place?? Yes I know, but they put chihuahua cheese on them, melt it, albeit in a Microwave, but somehow the fries come out tasting amazing.  Especially with their red salsa. They only accept cash, but have an ATM inside and Chase and B of A ATMS are about 50 feet away.  The guys that work here are very friendly and are patient with the drunk Wrigley-goers that often come here.  Come hungry and you will leave satisfied!
The best burritos in town.  I have been going there for 20 years and still fantastic every time!!!! Wish they had more locations.

Mr Beautiful: "How big are your burritos?" Cook: "This big." (Uses hands to say nearly 6 inches) Mr Beautiful: "Oh, ok. Give me one steak burrito, two tongue tacos, and a horchata." Clearly, there was a misunderstanding when I asked how big the burritos were. I was asking about length, he was talking about thickness. I realized that when I saw the girth of the ginormous steak burrito they brought to my table. All I have to say is that I was glad that I had not eaten all day because that giant freak of a burrito along with the two tongue tacos and a large horchata were the equivalent of three meals in one sitting! The burrito was pretty good. The steak in it was juicy, and I liked that they put avocado in it too. YUMMY! The tongue tacos were very good too. I like the simplicity of the tongue taco: corn tortilla, tongue, onion, and cilantro. You can't go wrong with that. The best part about their tongue tacos is that the meat is tender and isn't overcooked like at many other taquerias. Oh, and the horchata... it's the same everywhere, but I LOVE it. I could probably drink that stuff all day if I could! I like this no frills hole-in-the-wall taqueria. They're fast, cheap, friendly, their salsa has flavor & a kick to it, and the food is good. You definitely get more bang for your buck here, just make sure to bring cash because they don't take plastic. I'm a fan and I'm sure I'll be back, but next time, I'll make sure to be more specific when asking questions about the food. Holla!!!™

Alright, so this is not the highest quality Mexican food you'll ever it, but it sure is good for the price! And it's a great location - right next door to the Addison red line. Yes, that means it's packed with drunk people late at night on the weekends, but who can blame them? A big, cheap, fatty burrito is just the fix after a night out. Last time I was there it was pretty empty - only because it was a late week night. I loooove tortas, so that's what I had. And of course a giant (and I mean huuuuuge) orchata. My boyfriend had quesadillas with beans and rice and a pop. Our total - $15. And let's not forget the complimentary chips and 3 kids of salsa (that's only if you eat inside though). All that for 15 bucks? Count me in any day!

This place is so convenient off the Red Line that its become a place where we go when we don't want to cook and just want something fast and GOOD.  We have never been disappointed coming here.  The staff are always friendly, the service is always fast and the food is truly quality stuff.  The restaurant itself is kind of yucky but that definitely does not overshadow the rest of it.  I went in there the other day to get food before the bus arrived and within 6 minutes I walked out with yummy cheese enchiladas and I was happy.

Somewhere over the course of last nights epic party I managed to down El Burrtio Mexicano on two separate occasions.  Here is a breakdown of my experience. Round #1 - Torta Asada (Steak) con Aquacate (Avocado) I don't know if it is the fact that I look like a bro, or that I was giving off the  I'm throwing a huge party and I'm loaded with booze in the trunk vibe.  Either way the first thing the cook asks, even before asking for my order is, "Tienes Cerveza?"  ("Do you have beer in English).  I was caught slightly off guard so I gave him a few second stare down.  Once he smiled, I said "Un Minuto" and I went to the car.  I popped open that case and brought a fresh vortex miller light bottle in for the three guys on staff.   Free beer increases popularity.  You see it all the time in high school when a dork throws a party, and this works just as well in other real life scenarios.  I made my order and sat down.  Immediately one of the guys came over with a big bowl of chips and assorted salsa's and he brought cups of water to our table.  Our food was out fast and the person asked if everything was alright and if he could get us anything more.  We were just happy to eat, and told him "todo bueno".  The food was very good and I polished off every last morsel.  We leave and the guy said "Hasta manana" (see you tomorrow), which must have planted a seed in my head. Round #2 - Burrito Asada (Steak) con Aquacate (Avocado) 3:30AM rolls around and I'm starving.  Thank you El Burrito Mexciano for being approximately 1.3 blocks away from my house.  I bring along my best friends (and 9 cans of assorted 12 oz. beers for leverage "wink wink").   We roll in at a fairly busy hour, and I suggest a trade "Beer for Food".  All the faces in the restaurant look new (from the hours previous), so I'm wondering how this will work.  "None of us drink amigo" says the guy at the register.  I'm shocked, and I decide to take my leverage material off the table to keep out of plain sight.  Oh well, I'm a little buzzed and sure as hell not going to Bacci under any condition, so I decide to go with the burrito. Good surprises all around with that choice.  I was very surprised by the extra kick in my burrito which seemed like it had a sliced jalepeno or serrano thrown in.  Good surprise, especially in such cold conditions.  I polished off that burrito like it was my business, and I proceed to spread the love by handing out the remaining cans of beer to the patrons eagerly waiting to order.  Salud! I leave Round #2 more satisfied than Round #1.  Another memorable party and dining books recorded in the archives....
I've eaten there many times, and there's nothing better at 2:00 Am than this place.  Excellent Mexican restaurant!! Highly recommend.
Good food, good meat... Good God, Let's EAT! Today was the first time that I ate here sober, and it tasted just as good as it always does!  Who would have thought?! Thanks, guys!
Tasty, reasonable al pastor tacos near Wrigley.  How can that not sound good?

Before I even moved to Chicago, I would come visit friends for North Halstead Market Days every August.  After we went to the clubs late into the evening, we would always stop here for burritos, let me just say that it continues to be a favorite place of mine.  They make the best vegetarian burritos and it hits the spot after a night out at the clubs in boystown!  Saved me many times from going to bed with an empty stomach and having to wake up the next morning with a hangover.  So if you want some good tasting, cheap mexican food...look no further, this place is the best!!
I love this place. It's right by my house, it's open super late and they make the best inexpensive veggie buritto around. Cash only though.

I live a block from El Burrito Mexican yet had to search for "Burrito under red line" because I couldn't remember the name of this little taqueria.  That pretty much sums up my thoughts on this place: good enough to be able to describe where it's located but not memorable enough to recall its name.  When I moved to Chicago from NYC, I was excited because NYC lacks in taquerias (but makes up for it with late-night slices).  Having El Burrito Mexicano nearby is a definite plus.  The food doesn't blow me away, mostly because it's a bit too greasy (even by hole-in-wall standards) and sometimes the meat just isn't quite the right texture.  Nevertheless, it's a great option when craving a late night fix, as long as it's not within an hour of the Cubs game getting out!

i don't know how taco bell survives next to this place- it must just be their parking lot.  who knows. this place is awesome!  the food is fantastic, and you have to get the horchata.  the guys behind the counter are sweet and good at what they do!  the tacos are never too greasy and come loaded with toppings.  it's perfect for a quick take-out dinner or late night craving.

Yum yum YUM!  I tend to order out from here at least once a week, sometimes more if I'm feeling especially lazy.  It's ridiculously delicious, and way better than the other Mexican joints in the area.  I introduced my parents to it once when they were visiting from Detroit, and now we have to stop here everytime they're in town.  Hey I'm not complaining!   Love the burritos, especially the one covered in gooey melted cheese.  The burrito dinners are lots o' food so sometimes I forego the rice & beans if I'm not starving.  And they have 4 housemade salsas, which are amazing, try them all.
Mmm, late-night burritos, tacos and nachos with guac.  This place is unfailingly yummy. Convenient location, too - right off the Addison red line stop.

Free chips and salsa!  Hands down the best thing about this place if you eat in (no freebies for take out).  Downside is its cash only.  This is my go to place because its one of the cheapest joints to eat at in the neighborhood.  I've never been disappointed with their food but I usually only get the chicken tacos.  I think I'll venture out and try the breakfast burrito next time.

This isn't my favorite Mexican place in the city... BUT, it is my favorite Mexican place close to where I work, and its also inexpensive, and pretty tasty (a combination that seems to be pretty difficult to find in Wrigleyville). I almost always get the chile relleno tacos here, but one day I would really like to try the lengua tortas (yes ma'am, that's tongue).  I just like that they sell lengua tortas, that kind of offering makes Nessa a happy girl, just because I know its there if I ever want it.  In fact, I dare say that I won't consider a Mexican restaurant as one of my regular joints in any particular 'hood UNLESS they offer lengua... or brains, or something interesting. The guacamole is filling, to say the least.  To say the most, I might have to suggest that you feel like you just ingested a brick... a really yummy, tasty brick. The guys who work here are pretty cool, and patient with the before/after Cubs crowd (more patient than the before/after Cubs crowd usually is with them).  They don't mind switching the TV channel from a Spanish soap opera to the baseball game if you ask, which I really appreciate. All in all, this is a pretty stand-up joint.
Great as a late-nite burrito stop.  I go there when I'm in the area.  Cheap.  Cash only

After camping out in Pilsen, coming back to Lakeview really killed me with the lack of good, authentic Mexican food. Salud El Burrito Mexicano! Ok, I know this place is still a greasy, fast-food joint that's in the heart of Wrigleyville.  But honestly, you can't beat $4.25 for a full-size torta (Mexican burger), less than $2/taco with lettuce/onion, burritos for under $6, not to mention the friendliest chefs & cashier you will ever meet!!   Their horchata is great, not the creamiest I've had but with the right balance of cinnamon spices & rice milk.  I love the tortas & tacos, and wouldn't trade it for any Chipotle down Broadway!! Seriously, give this place a try on a weekday, mid-day or early dinner. Avoid the drunken frat boys, and I guarantee you will have a waaaaaaaay better experience!

Eaten here more than I care to admit....but I love the breakfast burritos, and actually pretty much everything else on the menu.....sometimes the meat is a little bit sketchy, so if your'e not okay with that pass on by.....I'll second the many praising it's value as drunk munchies....maybe the best drunk munchies in the area.   The downside is that it can be packed with drunk cubs game fans.......

After watching "Mexico One Plate at a Time" with Rick Bayless I had a craving for a torta so I went to the closest option available.  This place makes one hell of a delicious torta chicken and beef, so for that they get an extra star.
Simply the best burrito in Wrigleyville (or quite possibly Chicago), I have  yet to find a better burrito joint.

Who is dumb enough to go to Mexico for a week and eat authentic Mexican cuisine and return to Chicago and head to this place the day of?  Yours Truly. Having been on vacation, I had no groceries in my house.  Not to mention, upon my return it was bone-chillingly cold.  That meant I was only going a one block radius of my house to get my dinner for the evening.  Subway always works well and is the closest cheap eats to my place, but this one is right across the street and I wanted something hot (Temperature hot, not spicy) as opposed to the cold Italian foot-long BMT I'd get at Jared's place.  I rarely eat at El Burrito Mexicano at a reasonable hour (as most Reviewers here have probably noted), but this place is actually good no matter when you show up. Today I went with the Pork Burrito.  It is excellent, and much better than another burrito place just as close further east that I no longer bother going to. Other staples here that I highly recommend are the chicken burritos, steak burritos, and the three steak taco dinner.  That drink they have is also good. If you're scared to taste it, ask for a sample, they'll give it you. I would look up the name of it, but Im too tired and jet-lagged. Biggest plus is that it's pretty darn cheap.  In today's economy, this place is a gold mine. If you're in the neighborhood, I'll put my name behind the fact that this is the best Burrito joint within a two block radius of Wrigley.  Head over and enjoy! Tell em I sent you......

Best Burrito in town.   Simply referred to as "The Burrito under the El" by me and my friends. I will gladly take a $20 cab ride from Bucktown up to the Burrito under the El....often passing 5-10 other burrito joints along the way.  It is worth it. Trust me.   While I have ordered several  other items off the menu including the nachos, tacos, chips & salsa, horchata, and tortas, all of which are delicious..... my go to option is the steak burrito with everything (I add cilantro, onions, and avocado).      The steak burrito here is a glorious symphony of harmonious bliss.  With every bite, you get a balanced explosion of  textures, temperatures, and flavors.  Hot & juicy steak, cool & crunchy lettuce, soft & velvety beans,  and savory melted cheese, all bundled together in a slightly crisp yet tender Snuggie of a tortilla shell.  Simple, yet amazing. When judging a quality burrito..the #1 thing that I look for is quality of meat.  The steak here is always juicy and caramelized and never fatty.  Nothing will ruin a burrito moment quicker than taking a huge bite and chewing on a gristly piece of meat.  I have never had this happen while dining at El Burrito Mexicano (Drunk or Sober). I consider myself a burrito connoisseur....I take my burritos and tacos very seriously.  This place is definitely worth a special trip up to Addison street...right underneath the Red Line.

This is a great place for fast food Mexican.  Their pork is very yummy.   I also recently had the skirt steak dinner and made 6 taco's out of it (shared with my boyfriend).  Not bad for 10 bucks.  There guac is very tasty.  If your really hungover or drunk....get their pork nacho's (with sour cream on the side).

Love it! Whether tipsy or sober, this place never disappoints.  They're chicken tacos are delicious!! That's usually what I order. Their horchata, nachos, and tostadas are fantastic too.  Location is very convenient- They're located just east of the Addison Red Line stop.  Be sure to bring cash, b/c they don't take credit cards. There's an ATM inside though, just in case you forget.  Yummy!! :)
I've only eaten here sober.  Very good tacos.  Yum.   I wish they delivered.

So great to have a consistently tasty dive-of- a-mexican place near home.  When I don't know what to do for dinner, it is a no brainer to pick up a few tacos and chips and guacamole.  Very tasty.  And they make the gaucamole fresh... chop chop chop.  Don't forget the spicy sauces!  Yum!

Ok, I give this 4 stars when I'm completely obliterated, starving, and swaying in place while waiting in line.....Open until 4am, this place serves gynormous burros!  Pork, Chicken, Steak, Chorizo......lettuce, sour cream, guac....beans...DAYUM SUN, it's some good eatin'.  Ahhhh...and please don't overlook the Horchata....because that my friend, is a hangover preventer!!!   Honestly just the smell from outside will put your brain on auto pilot....cause the next thing you know you are standing at the counter, and the chubby messican dude is asking you, "que quieres?" BUUUUUUUUUTTTTT, unfortunately when sober, I will have to give this 2.5 stars.  It was a little dissapointing at first.....but then I said to myself, "emmer e., only come here when your liver has throwin in the towel!"  Hence, I kept it 4 greazy ass stars!   P.S. It kicks McDonalds' Ass, aaaaaaaaaannnnd is a 1.5 minute walk from my front door.... Happy Drinking!

Man, do I love this place.  I order the Steak Burrito dinner every time I go here and it never disappoints.  With so many authentic places to choose from on Ashland or Western, this gem by Wrigley is by far my favorite in the city.

Throw caution to the wind and treat your body to the taste sensation that is the chicken burrito at El Burrito Mexicano.  While this is the only dish I have consumed at said location, I have reason to believe that it is, in fact, the only item on the menu you need acquire and ingest.  Allow me to enumerate several of its benefits: --Flavor.  Don't be overwhelmed by imitators--this burrito delivers up the most meat-and-grease infused concoction inside of a tortilla this side of Hormel.  Nevermind the other ingredients that are supposedly inside that floury envelope... being able to taste them would simply interfere with the true essence of this timeless food being rapidly absorbed into your too-drunk bloodstream. --Portability.  This little burrito can--and WILL--travel.  It's especially useful for those times when you're en route to your next cold one and you need a little something to batten down the hatches.  Just slide open the bag, peel back that tin foil, and take that big bite as you stride up and down Sheffield like a drunken idiot.  Go ahead, pour the hot sauce on it while you walk!  You never really liked that shirt anyway.  Its small size makes for easy transport, whether it's on the el, in a cab, or under your jacket as you sneak in to catch the last 20 minutes or so of some karaoke asshole at the Holiday Club. --Portion Size.  Don't say EBM never gave you anything.  This giant burrito packs a punch bigger than those chipot-qdob-panche-whatsits guys and delivers it in package that, when unfolded, could likely swaddle a large chihuahua if not a small infant.  Seriously, if you are hungry enough that you could eat 4, maybe 5 normal sized meals, this chicken burrito will leave you sated--BUT JUST BARELY. Look, man. You're drunk and right next to Wrigley Field.  You're clearly not looking for gourmet.  Just eat the thing, feel guilty about it the next day (oh, you'll definitely be reminded you ate it when you take a trip to the can), and move on.  But remember that this shit isn't gonna win any prizes any time soon. Unless some drunk asshole accidentally leaves behind a bowling trophy on the bench in there or something.

Doesn't get any better than this for late night food.  Love the breakfast burritos, el pastor is great, and the nachos have more avocado and cheese on them than I know what to do with (this is a good thing).  Food even tastes great when you're not drunk.  Grab a six pack from the corner store and have a delicous byob dinner before going out.

Hands down the thing I miss most about living in Wrigley!!!  At first I thought that it was only good drunk food but got some STEAK NACHOS one day after work and devoured them just as quick.  Get them, they are amazing!  The queso cheese is soo good with always fresh avacodos.  Great!!!!!!

This is the only place I've found in Chicago that will make a very good order of Carne Asada Fries (it's a California thing)... I have to convince them to make the special order each time though. Otherwise it can be a hassle. For those of you who are wondering what Carne Asada Fries are, it's: fries, cheese, carne asada, avocado (guacamole elsewhere), pico de gallo, beans (if you like beans), sour cream, and lime juice. You kind of have to think of it as super nachos but on fries instead of chips. It's the only thing I order here, but I've also had their ground beef nachos which were pretty good too.

This place is awesome for abusing your body with some Mexican food after a late night.  They are open late (4:30am I think) which is just spectacular.  After a night of bars/clubs stumbling into this goldmine is heavenly.  The nachos are great, they load them up with avocado and cheese and sour cream....yum!  The tacos and chips and salsa are nice too.  The service is quick and they never judge regardless of how drunk...or....hungover...what I meant to say...under the weather you are feeling.   For some reason I always order too much  and have leftovers the next day - a perfect meal to start off your day/afternoon (depending on when you roll out of bed after a night out).
While the I haven't had too much success branching out beyond the staples this is a solid burrito place and has excellent chorizo which makes great breakfast burritos.

I love this place.  Whether it's for late night or dinner, I think it's delicious.  It's cheap and the staff is nice.  If you eat here you get free chips and salsa before your meal...which is a huge plus to me :)  Wish they had cheaper nachos though...

Identical to El Burrito Mexico in Lisle?  yelp.com/biz/el-burrito-… I'm pretty sure it is, as everything is almost identical, but regardless this is a solid place for a tasty burrito, tacos, etc... all of the staples.   If you were coming from/going to the bars around here I already feel bad for you, but if you choose the Taco Bell the other way on Addison instead of El Burrito Mexicano, I feel really bad for you!

This place is great. Cheap and filling. So much better than that crappy taco bell down the street. It can get crazy crowded right around 2AM since that's when all the bars let out, but it *is* open at 2AM which is primetime for the alcoholic's diet. For a hole in the wall, the food is tasty (I've gone for a quick dinner) and the nachos and salsa are free. Free! Well, as long as it's not right after 2AM or something like that. I mean, come on. Drunk people with free nachos and salsa? Might as well have a "please bankrupt me" sign if you're gonna do that.

I went to this place around 4 AM last night.  I wasn't even hungry. From what I remember, the chicken burrito was damned tasty.  Like an a-hole, I brought the burrito onto the L and made a mess on my clothing and floor of the train.  I apologize to the CTA and those with disgusted looks on their faces around me. I'll be back if I'm in the neighborhood.

This is my favorite mexican place in the city. Weird because they get a lot of cubs traffic, but I think its delicious. I brought my boyfriend's dad here, who was visiting us. He's from Mexico City, so I hold his opinion pretty high. He loved it. he had the stuffed peppers, and I don't know if its because the guys working were happy to see another Mexican among the wrigleyvillers, but they gave us free salsa to take home and free guacamole. The food is great, the salsas rock my socks, and I LOVE the chicken tacos. I miss living within walking distance of this place. I haven't had it in a really long time. sigh...

A couple of tipsy encounters with the red line have dumped me square in front of El Burrito Mexicano. How convenient! The carne burrito? Not my type. They throw the lettuce, avocado and sour cream in with the rest of the hot fillins' and then grill it. Hot lettuce rendezvousing with warm dairy products? Me thinks no.

I used to live 2 blocks from this place and had to pass it every time i came home from the bar and I just couldn't resist. The burritos are worth the mass amount of calories. The steak and chicken are so good! The rice is good as well and lets not even get started on the guacamole. It's very garlicky but with the fried chips, oh man! The employees are also willing to deal with people who forget to pay- my roommate, and people who rip the grate off the vent in the floor accidentally by getting it stuck in their stiletto, twice- me. So just go!

This place is a dive, but it's an awesome dive. It is good, authentic Mexican food at a reasonable price - and it has a ton of items on the menu that are among the best Mexican I've ever eaten. If you are in this neighborhood, then this is a place that you need to stop by.

This place does an OK job making a burrito. It is literally steps from where I live, so I have been there before.  But, here is what I have to say. Get the tostadas. Those are the best deal out there for you broke folks. I think about 1.75 and loaded with meat and sour cream and beans and stuff. A bargain!

For a homogenous ethnic/econo 'hood (read - all white, middle class) and an all-american named Mexican spot (The Mexican Burrito) this place is in the top 10% of burrito joints in the city. Try and get there before midnight on going out nights or it's like a sweaty frat party. This is the first Chicago burrito I had years ago and I returned last night for the first time in over 5 yrs. Still really good.

The place actually has good food surprisingly.  It looks like your typical hole in the wall, but I really like their sauce.  I suggest going early to avoid people who decide that they are going to ask the 4 people working at the time if they are brothers despite them looking nothing alike.

The food here is really, really good.  And the horchata is perfect (after a long night of drinking, it tastes like the nectar of the gods). The only downside is waiting in the hot, steamy restaurant for your food - the seating area is almost in the kitchen and it's not the most delightful atmosphere, but the guys who work there are nice and the food is great.

I live approximately 50 feet from this place... in fact I see it outside my apartment window as I write this review. This is the place where I fell in love with that (non) ubiquitous Mexican sandwich, the Torta.  Get it with ground beef, get it with chicken... just try it out. The bread is amazing, and it's a great way to experience the mexican meal. Many times I've waken up with the gruesome remains of the meal... a large piece of foil, some lettuce shards, some meat... not remembering eating it. After seeing that, I know I had a great night. I've eaten here sober as well... and somehow tastes even better.

the picadillo tacos are wonderful.  the art/decor is amazing - think ceramic donkey plus painting of an idyllic old New England mill plus framed dollar bills.  if you are sober (or just hate moe's cantina as much as i do) and you come here after midnight, you will want to punch at least 7 customers while waiting in line.

A dilapidated plywood shack featuring surprisingly decent Mexican grub. The food isn't bad, even if you're intimidated by the availability of "tongue" on the menu board.  It tastes good going down, but your digestive system will ball itself into a fist and start punching you in the neck within a few hours. Caveat emptor, but if the emptor is drunk, he'll enjoy his meal.

While many other people who are reviewing El Burrito will say it is an amazing late night place, I posit it is in fact much more than that, perhaps the greatest burrito ever.  If you enjoy a good steak burrito with the requisite sour cream, avacado and beans then you will love this burrito.  Is it greasy?  YES!  Is it healthy?  HELL NO!  My question is: is a burrito supposed to be healthy, OF COURSE NOT!  Revel in El Burrito's unhealthiness, and enjoy it fro what it is, and don't expect it to be anything else, you will love it, I do.

This is my go-to drunken Mexican joint in Chicago (certainly, it helps that it's a mere stumble from my apartment).  The picadillo tacos are the stuff of legend - perfectly seasoned, with little chunks of carrot and potato.  The pastor is awe-inspiring as well, not to mention the chile relleno taco.  I would drink the salsa verde out of a Double Gulp container if I had the opportunity.   My El Burrito experience is enhanced by the guys working the grill - in particular, the man my friend dubbed "The Angry Chef."  He's an astoundingly large man whose wardrobe consists solely of thrift store t-shirts, and never seems to be happy (that said, you wouldn't be too happy slinging burritos to drunken Cubs fans at 3 a.m.).  I take that back, actually.  When a cute girl walks in, The Angry Chef comes out of his shell, throwing down lude pick-up lines that would make a construction worker blush. But I digress.  The food here is great.  But the restaurant itself is scary.   Dirt everywhere.  Downright frightening bathroom.  Horrific clientele.  But hey, you're not seeking out Frontera Grill.  If you want a cheap, tasty taco, and happen to like spending your evenings at (God forbid) Moe's Cantina, this is the place for you.

I agree with Joshua M. This place is like any other taqueria in San Diego. I guess we're spoiled out there.   Decent veggie burrito for a decent price.  Nothing spectacular, but it was the first taqueria I've seen since I moved out here so I was stoked to have some soul food.

Greatest burritos in the world.  And i'm not even a big burrito guy.  Especially good at 4AM after a full day of baseball and full night of drinking!  I have season Cubs tickets and love to "Treat" myself to this place before heading back to reality.

When I first moved to Chicago, this was my go-to late-night starving, but-not-really-starving, but-i-think-i'm-starving, burrito joint.  Always, always came through in the clutch.  Everything i sampled was good, especially the nachos.   Only three stars b/c the place just seems shady inside and out.  I tend to stick with the "nicer" options these days, if you can call Burrito House and that Mexican place at Irving and Sheffield "nicer".  But I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Really this place is a little scary... but being from San Diego originally I have eaten in endless places such as this.  The difference is in San Diego they are all usually amazingly good.  This place... not that great.  But I think the trick is really avoiding the meat here.  I had a chicken burrito the first time around, and the grade of meat they were using didn't seem to be of any quality.  The second time back I went to a vegetarian type burrito and then it was fine.

El Burrito is serious business, enjoying a prime location underneath the Addison El stop. The brick wall outside boasts that El Burrito has the "best" burritos in town. I don't know what kind of scientific analysis they undertook to prove this claim, or what the measurements of evaluation were. What I do know is that you won't get anywhere in this town if you can't trust what's written on a brick wall under the El tracks. Besides, if you are stumbling home after too many Old Styles, can you really afford to be that picky?

Sometimes, you find yourself, tummy a-rumblin', sitting in your apartment with a kitchen full of food, yet no cookware with which to prepare it, because it all belongs to your roommate, who is packing up to move halfway across the country. At these times, you may also find yourself torn between eating wheat bread with peanut butter, thereby saving your last tenner for the commute to work, and walking a few blocks to get a $5 burrito, thereby procuring a filling, hot meal while also leaving you just enough cash to get to and from work until payday. This is pretty much the only occasion for which Burrito Mexicano should be on your radar. No, really. That said, the burritos ain't half bad, and since I'm Pujol-deep in this scenario right now, I've already been twice this week. I'm not complaining. I'm glad it's cheap, and close, and decent. I just don't visit when I have, say, a whole $10 to spare.

The decor here really sucks, but if you're wasted, and you need something to soak up all the alcohol in your stomach, this is the place!  Service is pretty quick, and the burritos will bring you back to your college days with their greasy saltiness.  Yum!

I love this place for late-night burritos. They are open *really* late, which is great after a long evening of drinking. The food is good and the staff are fun (especially considering the drunkenness of most people in there). They put up with all forms of drunken attempts at spanish with a smile. I've had more excellent nights than I can count being out with my friends, capped off with a burrito and horchata (rice milk) from this place and then going home to crash at 4am...
I like this place very much every time I need a fast greasy burrito. It's convenient, very tasty and not dry. I always get the stake burrito with sour cream and they never screwed it up!

An average of 3 stars because El Burrito Mexicano is exactly that. Average. Better than standard late night fare when you're drunk; not the burrito place to hit when you're craving cheap Mexican food for dinner.

The chiles rellenos are awesome here, and the guys behind the counter are friendly.  Food is good, plentiful and cheap, but don't go here on a night when the Cubs are playing, because you can't get near the place.

Also known as "that burrito place under the addison red line" this place my current regular burrito place- partly because I live near by and partly because it is so good.  The burritos, tortas and tostadas are very good (I usually get steak, but sometimes chicken).  The breakfast burrito is also recommended especially if you like chorizo.  Eat in and get the free chips and salsa.  The lines can get long on the weekend late nights, but its worth it. Get in that.

The very best burritos and tacos in town. You'll eat like a king and spend very little doing so. Also try the Horchata (rice water) next time you stop by. It tastes like the milk in the cereal bowl after you eat Cinnamon Toast Crunch.

This place is fair and fairly authentic. The flavor could be better. The food is cheap and the people are friendly, especially if you order in Spanish. Get off the train, walk up and get a taco. What's better than that? I see other reviews saying how dirty they are. Come on! Buck up! It's a hole-in-the-wall burrito joint!

One of the sketchier places I've ever seen, but that is nearly a prerequisite for good Mexican food.  This place is fantastic.  I stop by right off the Addison el stop on the way home from work all the time.  The nachos are amazing with huge slices of fresh avocado and sour cream.  !Excellente!

I have a great face that captures a reaction of skepticism, reservation and concern.  (I can show you sometime--think crinkled face and raised eyebrow.) That's how you might react walking in here in terms of cleanliness and atmosphere. But... (of course there's a 'but.' I gave it three stars.) ...when you've had a few to drink (better yet, a lot) and you see this little restaurant as your redline train rolls into the Addison stop, those tacos sound.look.smell pretty damn good.  And I sure do love that Orchata (that crazy rice drink)--nothing classier than a walk home down Halsted with a super-large styrofoam cup of Orchata.
I heard that this place had the best burritos in town. Maybe I stopped in on an off day, but mine tasted like high school cafeteria. I will stop back another day to be fair.
Great drunk food!  Perfectly situated around all the bars and wrigleyville action, there's no excuse not to soak up some alcohol with a nice burrito

Risk Takers rejoice! If you can beyond the fact that this place is a bit unsanitary and located right under the el tracks, you are in for some of the best post-bar food around. Really good burritos and tacos.
